lines.text: Ladies and gentlemen and children of all ages, we're going to present for your approval a novelty picture with an all midget cast, the first of it's kind to ever be produced. I'm told that it has everything, that is everything that a western should have.
Seems to me that I smell something that should be buried - smells mighty like a polecat.
I'm the hero. After this picture's out, I'll be the biggest cowboy star in Hollywood.
I'm the villain. I'm the toughest hombre that ever lived, and I ain't afraid o' the biggest one o' you. I'm the Terror of Tiny Town, and that's the star part.
Wait a minute! Men! Men! Wait a minute!
I'm warnin' you, Tex. Don't start no trouble in town.
I don't want trouble. But I won't run away from it, either!
I wonder who those hombres are?
Let's pick up the trail and see what they're up to.
Dad, I jumped a bunch o' rustlers at work.
They left in such a hurry, they forgot their branding iron.
That's the way I read it.
